CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 9, 1953, pg. 32, reads: "E. L. Smith, Builder, From Blueprint To New Community - New Homes Are News - Few Pittsburgh Negroes have ever had the privilege of living in a new home. Within recent years, E. L. Smith has built more new homes for Negroes than any other local building contractor. Operating principally on the East End - Penn Township sector, he has sparked the emergence of a new community in this area.  Here our photographer has taken pictures of phases of the Smith operation, as he converts raw land into a setting for graceful living. - Harris Photos."  "Going Up - Carpenters cut and set as the insulation is delivered the framework of a new home at the extreme left."
TitMainTitle: Workers, including carpenters, gathered around pile of lumber and framing house, at construction site, possibly East End
